intro: Callista praegnans, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to humans and animals. Callista praegnans typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
